ogre3d

08 Mar 2006 Since the gym is overcrowded (AGAIN), I'm gonna try and get a small Ogre3D example working.

My journey begins here: http://www.ogre3d.org/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=5706. I don't want to compile Ogre3D from source and want to use the Debian packages instead.

assembling

06 Mar 2006 Now that the mainboard is picked, the new machine is getting some form.
The mainboard will be a MSI K8N-Diamond-54G, with Socket 939 processor. The people from MSI recommend a 450W power supply (w00t). I'm sure I'll need that anyway if the machine will have 6 disks.

Damnit, I just checked the snogard site again, and they are no longer selling the mainboard I want :( They still sell the more expensive version though, the K8N Diamond Plus

quest for a mainboard (3)

05 Mar 2006 This is a review for the ASUS A8N32-SLI Deluxe

On this page (aswell as the previous review) it is said that the MSI motherboards have better sound than the MSI.

Considering all this, I'm going for the MSI K8N-Diamond-54G. It has more SATA controllers and better sound than the ASUS A8N32-SLI Deluxe, yet is cheaper than the MSI K8N-Diamond Plus.

my kingdom for a book

04 Mar 2006 After going to Pearl Vision to buy me some contact lenses (they will call me when they arrive), I went to the book-fair with Spie.
There were some fine books last year and I remember that we spent quite some time over there last time. This year however, the choice was somewhat limited. And when I say limited I mean there were no good books. At all. I any category. At the entire fair.

I'm starting to become aware of the difference in knowledge between the average joe and university students...
You can find just about any book on computers that talks about how to do whatever in Windows, or how to use the internet (after 10 years, I think most people know how to use it, really). But if you look for some scientific work, where are you supposed to go ? Are there actually some fairs for scientific books ?
Well, we left much sooner than expected, and I didn't buy anything.

On a totally different subject, the battery of my car died again. Instead of jumpstarting again, I bought a battery charger this time. It works nicely and I'm sure I'll have to use it a lot in the future.

quest for a mainboard (2)

04 Mar 2006 I started looking at the mainboards with builtin videocard, but then I noticed none of them have more than 4 SATA ports. And I need atleast 5, preferably 6 (5 for the RAID and 1 for the /)

Looking at the SATA ports, there are 2 with 8 ports, 2 with 6 and 1 with 5.
Both mainboards with 8 ports don't actually have 8 ports but only 4, I was wrong :(

The choice is between these motherboards:
Asus A8N32-SLI Deluxe
MSI K8N-Diamond-54G
MSI K8N Diamond Plus
Older Newer
